abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Education and Training
            Project's overall outcome was satisfactory. This
            project demonstrates that projects in small countries with
            limited resources can be successfully implemented where
            there is strong stakeholder commitment to reform, and where
            there is political and administrative commitment to setting
            and achieving high quality standards. In this instance the
            level of parental commitment to education manifested itself
            in the much larger than expected enrollment in the new
            junior secondary institutions, and in post-secondary
            courses, and improving equitable access to school. For
            effective project implementation, an efficient and
            autonomous Project Implementation Unit (PIU) is a necessary
            condition. Investment in developing PIU capacity can have
            wider benefit to contribute to an increase in public sector
            management efficiency. The fellowship scheme has proved
            successful in developing much-needed expertise and
            knowledge. Fellowship placements should commerce early
            during project implementation to allow for completion of
            studies within the project period. Cost-recovery mechanisms
            should be implemented as soon as beneficiaries return from
            overseas study. Community commitment to education can have a
            strong positive impact. Improving the internal efficiency of
            an education system by increasing student-teacher ratios
            requires strong government commitment.
